Chapter 188 – The shaving (of the head) and the shortening (of the hair, nails etc.)

titles.ar: بَابُ الْأَكْلِ مِنَ الْهَدْيِ الْوَاجِبِ وَ الصَّدَقَةِ مِنْهَا وَ إِخْرَاجِهِ مِنْ مِنًى
titles.en: Chapter 186 – The eating from the sacrificial animal, the Obligatory one, and the giving of the charity from it, and taking it out from Mina
Chapter 187 – Skins of the sacrificed animals

gradings: Allamah Baqir al-Majlisi: حسن - Mir‘at al ‘Uqul Fi Sharh Akhbar Al al Rasul (18/184)

narrator_chain.text: عَلِيُّ بْنُ إِبْرَاهِيمَ عَنْ أَبِيهِ عَنِ ابْنِ أَبِي عُمَيْرٍ عَنْ حَفْصِ بْنِ الْبَخْتَرِيِّ عَنْ أَبِي عَبْدِ اللَّهِ ( عليه السلام ) قَالَ

text: نَهَى رَسُولُ اللَّهِ ( صلى الله عليه وآله ) أَنْ يُعْطَى الْجَزَّارُ مِنْ جُلُودِ الْهَدْيِ وَ أَجْلَالِهَا شَيْئاً .

en.hubeali: Ali Bin Ibrahim, from his father, from Ibn Abu Umeyr, from Hafs Bin Al Bakhtary,
(It has been narrated) from Abu Abdullah<sup>asws</sup> having said: ‘Rasool-Allah<sup>saww</sup> forbade giving of the hide, collar and covering of the offering animals to the butchers.
en.sarwar: 1. Ali ibn Ibrahim has narrated from his father from ibn abu ‘Umayr from Hafs ibn af-Bakhtariy who has said the following: “Abu ‘ Abd Allah, ‘Alayhi al-Salam, has said that the Messenger of Allah, O Allah, grant compensation to Muhammad and his family worthy of their services to Your cause, prohibited giving of the hide, collar and covering of offering animals to the butchers.”

gradings: Allamah Baqir al-Majlisi: مرسل ، حسن كالصحيح - Mir‘at al ‘Uqul Fi Sharh Akhbar Al al Rasul (8/184)
text: رِوَايَةِ مُعَاوِيَةَ بْنِ عَمَّارٍ عَنْ أَبِي عَبْدِ اللَّهِ ( عليه السلام ) قَالَ يُنْتَفَعُ بِجِلْدِ الْأُضْحِيَّةِ وَ يُشْتَرَى بِهِ الْمَتَاعُ وَ إِنْ تُصُدِّقَ بِهِ فَهُوَ أَفْضَلُ

وَ قَالَ نَحَرَ رَسُولُ اللَّهِ ( صلى الله عليه وآله ) بَدَنَةً وَ لَمْ يُعْطِ الْجَزَّارِينَ جُلُودَهَا وَ لَا قَلَائِدَهَا وَ لَا جِلَالَهَا وَ لَكِنْ تَصَدَّقَ بِهِ وَ لَا تُعْطِ السَّلَّاخَ مِنْهَا شَيْئاً وَ لَكِنْ أَعْطِهِ مِنْ غَيْرِ ذَلِكَ .

en.hubeali: And in another report – Muawiya Bin Ammar,

(It has been narrated) from Abu Abdullah<sup>asws</sup> having said: ‘Benefit (yourself) by the hide of the sacrificed animal, and buy the provisions with it, and if you were to give in charity with it, so it would be superior’.

And he<sup>asws</sup> said: ‘Rasool-Allah<sup>saww</sup> sacrificed a camel and did not give the butcher its hide, nor its collar, nor its decor (reins etc.), but he<sup>saww</sup> gave it in charity (instead); and do not give the butcher anything from it, but give him from other than that’.
en.sarwar: 2. In the narration of Mu’awiyah ibn ‘Ammar from abu ‘Abd Allah, ‘Alayhi al-Salam, it is said that the hide of animal for offering can be used for beneficial purposes or purchase thereby goods, but to give them as charity is better. He (the Imam) said that the Messenger of Allah, O Allah, grant compensation to Muhammad and his family worthy of their services to Your cause, slaughtered a badanah and did not give its hide to butchers or the decorative items but gave them as charity. You must not give the hide to those who skin animals, but give them from other things.’”
